}} 'Evelyn Fox Keller' (born March 20, 1936, New York) is an American physicist,
author and feminist. She is currently Professor Emerita of History
and Philosophy of Science at the Massachusetts Institute of
Technology. {{cite web
 | last = first = authorlink = coauthors = title = Evelyn Fox Keller MIT STS
 | Faculty page work = publisher = Massachusetts Institute of Technology date =
 | url = http://web.mit.edu/sts/people/keller.html archiveurl =
 | http://www.webcitation.org/6DKoaQTZw archivedate = 31 December 2012 doi =
 | accessdate = 31 December 2012 }} Keller's early work concentrated at
 | the intersection of physics and biology. Her subsequent research has focused
 | on the history and philosophy of modern biology and on gender and science.
